runs.comm: full on middle and leg, worked wide of mid-on but doesn't beat the fielder
on middle, tucked into the leg side and nearly a run out! Guptill turned and wanted a second but it was never on as Broad came around from mid-on
on leg stump, flicked away through midwicket and Finn has hit the stumps so that will be his one for the innings based a pre-match understanding
excellent shot, comes down the pitch and drives a back-of-a-length delivery wide of mid-off
goes shorter this time, Rutherford flicks it neatly through midwicket off the back foot
full on leg stump, he's a little fortunate that it only cost a couple...Broad pulled out a good dive at mid-on
nips into Rutherford's pads from a good length, drops into the off side behind square
back of a length on the stumps, Guptill into line and defends to the leg side. Yes, I said defend.
back of a length outside off, opens the face down to third man
short on leg stump, pulled towards Finn at short fine-leg who makes a good stop
well bowled, not going full, Guptill pushes off the back foot into the covers
full outside off, driven without much timing into the covers...the fielders are mostly on the edge of the cricle
starts full, Rutherford tried to use his feet but his drive skews off a thick inside edge then Dernbach dives in his follow through
on leg stump, he aims to whip it away but misses out and gets taken on the pad...the ball then bobbles to backward point
beaten! Nice from Dernbach, tight line outside off on a good length. Guptill neither forward or back
tight line, 140kph, middle and off, defended back down the pitch
offers a hint of width this time, cut away firmly behind point but third man is able to scoot around and keep them to two
this time he finds the boundary, gave himself a touch of room and scythed it square through backward point to beat third man. Still a good over from Dernbach
lovely strike, gets too full this time on off stump and Rutherford is able to drive handsomely through the line miles over long-off
back of a length and it brings reward. Rutherford went for the pull, was a little cramped for room, and it looped up off a top edge to midwicket
short of a length again, outside off, angled down to third man
that's power...the short ball can bring wickets, but also runs. He pulled it beautifully in front of square
a little fuller this time, McCullum pushes it into the off side
short and wide, gets away with it as Guptill cuts towards Wright at cover and he then has to scamper for the run
nips back into Guptill, doesn't have any room to play with, can only squirt it into the covers
more shape into the right hander, this time for a fuller length, worked into midwicket
on off stump, nicely bowled, Guptill gets half foward and pushes to backward point
gets this over the infield, not quite timed cleanly but it doesn't need to be. Short ball, wasn't a too bad a delivery, and McCullum gets it clear of midwicket
a proper bouncer this time which slides down the leg side, McCullum chased it with a pull shot

gone! Brilliant catch! Massive moment for England. Eoin Morgan has held a superb catch running back from point. McCullum used his feet, when for a booming drive and it slices off a thick edge. Morgan turned, kept his eye on the ball and swallowed the chance
back of a length at the body, Guptill can't get it away as Finn is quickly onto the ball from his follow through
full on the stumps, driven straight mid-on who manages to get across. Taylor is away.
very little pitched up from England's quicks, this is dropped to backward point, Morgan, who throws at the stumps but Taylor would have been safe
beauty! That's a cracker. Short of a length and it zips past Taylor's outside edge as feels away from his body
angled square through the off side behind point, to the right of third man but can't get a second out of it
touch fuller this time on off stump, pushed into the covers
too much width this time and he cashes in with a thrashing drive over the off side
outside off and runs it down to third man
back of a length, worked in front of square and deep midwicket can't cut off the second
clubbed down the ground, doesn't come out of the middle and goes in the air about half the way to long-on
clean, straight and big...drives beautifully straight down the ground. Seen a few of them today.
width outside off but he pushes it straight to point
again can't find a gap in the off side
poor ball down the leg side, big wide
and another, speared down the leg side, not a good start to a spell
that's better, full on off stump, pushed back down the pitch and Patel does well off his own bowling
worked into midwicket off the back foot...the second run is made very safe by an awful throw
angled into the legs again, goes for a sweep and it runs fine off the pads
pushed back to the bowler
full outside off, driven down to long-off
well bowled by Patel, fired in full outside off, gets squeezed off an edge past the keeper but Wright chases it down even with the short boundary
resume short of a length and beats the cut shot on the top edge with his extra pace
full on middle, driven down the ground...not quite the flow of boundaries we saw in England's innings
goes over mid-off, comes off the toe end of the bat and falls inches short of being a six
comes across the stumps, flicks straight to short fine-leg, Tredwell, and it was a pretty tight run
chopped to backward point where Morgan pulls off another good piece of work to keep it as a precious dot ball
finds the fielder! That's another crucial blow. Aiming one of his trademark midwicket blows off the front foot but doesn't get the distance. Came from low down on the bat. England safe in the field.
over the wicket, full on middle, worked past a diving midwicket
six on most grounds...a big slog-sweep over midwicket. Guptill doesn't even look at where the shot goes after hitting. Keeps his head dead still
played down the ground to long-on
worked down the on side, Patel dives over this one as he skips across in his follow through. Should have stopped it
opens the face towards backward point
flat on leg stump, tucked wide of midwicket to keep strike
down the pitch swinging to leg and doesn't make contact
another fresh-air shot, and this time it just misses off stump
three dot balls in a row, pressure grows on Munro as he cuts to backward point
make that four dots, excellent over from Wright. Munro tries to open the face but can't beat backward point
beats the infield this time, driving in front of square, and the sweeper slides around the boundary
that boosts the over for Munro and New Zealand, Wright drops it short and Munro latches on to send it over deep midwicket
pushed to the off side
nicely swept by Guptill, full on leg stump and he sends it very fine
pushed down the ground past a diving Tredwell
some invention from Munro as he goes for an expansive reverse sweep, almost gets himself in a tangle as the ball is fired in full and just a single to short third man
sweeps this very square, Morgan makes good ground to keep it to just a single
worked out to midwicket
short of a length, Munro goes for the pull and gets beaten again. The ball passes over middle stump
but there's a boundary, comes down the pitch and smashes a flat six over wide long off...now he has to follow it up

Well, what's happened here? Wright is appealing for a catch as Munro drives the ball into his boot. Wright followed through and took it. The umpires send it upstairs but it is ruled to be ground then boot. Good yorker, though.
Wright going full, aiming for the yorkers, clubbed down the ground
drilled! Straight to the captain. That should seal it for England. Guptill can't believe he has slotted a full ball straight to mid-off. Struck it cleanly, but didn't place it.
oh, excellent by Wright in his follow through. Was punched towards the on side and he dived to his left with an out-stretched hand to cut it off
down the pitch, ends up yorking himself, driven to long-off
lofted over long-on, a nice, well-controlled, punch
dropped square into the off side, was a short ball from Tredwell
another rather ugly attempt at a reverse sweep, or slog, by Munro and only gets him a single through the covers
worked along the ground through straight midwicket
poor ball, low full toss, and it's dispatched straight down the ground. Good over for New Zealand
strikes first ball back. Franklin moving to leg to open up the off side, another back-of-a-length delivery, and he gets a thick top edge
beaten outside off, comes right across his stumps...was a pretty wide delivery
into the off side

and another...Broad making a mark on his international return. Pretty ugly heave from Munro to a length delivery, an off-cutter that he didn't pick, and the stumps get splattered. Clever from Broad, subtle changes of pace
pulls a short ball through midwicket but didn't have much timing behind it
into the off side
short on the pads, McCullum's pull loops in front of short fine-leg
flicked through square leg
full on off stump, driven firmly through the off side
another short ball and nearly another wicket but the spliced pull falls short of Bairstow running in from deep midwicket
massive top edge and well caught by Buttler who steadied himself, much like McCullum earlier, and pouched it. He had to reach a little at the end, but had it under control
swung firmly down to long-on
another one goes, falling like skittles now, as Ellis gives himself room but can only lob the short ball to point...credit to Finn, to, as that was an off-cutter
nice! Steps to leg and slams this through the off side
banged in on leg stump, this time Hira looks a little awkward as he crouches down on his pull and finds short fine leg
well, it's a six, but Root nearly pulled off one of his boundary 'specials' by trying to flick the ball back. In fact, he was already stood on the rope at deep point when he first held the catch
chopped to backward point
comes down the pitch outside leg, heaves hard and gets a thick top edge which falls short of third man
full outside leg, nudged through midwicket
excellent slower ball, completely confounds Boult who was moving well outside leg stump
another full toss which is driven to deep cover
round the wicket, full outside off, thick edge down to third man
pulled down to long-on
moving away outside leg stump and gets beaten by a full ball outside off
short on leg stump, angled backward of point
four for Broad, he's having a productive start in New Zealand. Boult trying to carve it over the off side and lobs a catch to cover. Nearly popped out of Samit's hands
moving outside off and tried to scoop him over fine leg
and nearly gets his fifth as this flies off a top edge towards third man but doesn't carry all the way
excellent yorker, homing in on the boots and gets squeezed into the off side
short outside leg, pulled out to deep square
good yorker but he keeps it out
blimey! The No. 11 thinks he's a No. 4. Tries to scoop Dernbach and ends up falling over in the crease
rapid, well-directed, bouncer and McClenaghan gets taken on the helmet then the ball flies over the keeper
there's the variation, slower ball outside off stump
this time he gets his scoop away and makes a point of trotting down the pitch near to Dernbach
oh dear, this one slips out as a beamer...another attempted slower. Gets a warning
full outside leg and pushed down the ground to finish the match
